TopicTitle: So... What's the "cave-like underground formation on Tylo"?

Articles.Content: Any pic, video or coordinate?
Boom!
Oh thanks.
You can actually drive through it too. It's great for making a rover to hot rod through it.
I can't wait until the deb's flesh out the planets more. When that happens I'd expect the caves to extend underground into a cavern system. That'd be fun to explore.

I can't wait until the deb's flesh out the planets more. When that happens I'd expect the caves to extend underground into a cavern system. That'd be fun to explore.

And now I'm picturing flying rockets into an underground cave... sounds like something from a movie with a supervillain.

MY EVIL UNDERGROUND BASE ON THE MOON!
Yeah I really hope the underground caves in Tylo would be very extensive and labarinthine

And now I'm picturing flying rockets into an underground cave... sounds like something from a movie with a supervillain.

MY EVIL UNDERGROUND BASE ON THE MOON!

Yes. All of my yes. I'd like to race through them on a hoverbike of sorts.

EDIT: As of this moment: I am making said Bike.

Edited June 5, 2013 by Rage097
Spelunking on an alien world needs to be a feature.
I think some ancient underground ruin of a past Kerbal society would be freaking awesome. Promethieus style.. no actual aliens though just some hieroglyphics maybe.

They changed it. It's now really another arch.

I liked it when it was a proper cave. I'm wondering if this was intentional or a side effect of the new retexturing of the planets?

so, whats happen whith the cave? After many trys to land on Tylo with a Rover i find nothing on the Anomalies place! Only if I look under the ground - i find it! What can i do to move it on the right place? A configuration in the graphic settings maybe?

so, whats happen whith the cave? After many trys to land on Tylo with a Rover i find nothing on the Anomalies place! Only if I look under the ground - i find it! What can i do to move it on the right place? A configuration in the graphic settings maybe?

Try texture detail on max, or on minimum if that doesn't work.
I would call necro, but that is actually interesting. If only I could land on Tylo to check...
Minecraft + Ksp - Minecraft's community = 1 liter of pure awesome
I wish there were actual caves you could enter and explore. Would make for cool bases, science-hunting trips and Prometheus style cinematics

Try texture detail on max, or on minimum if that doesn't work.

I have tryed this - unfortunately without any effect - the cave is really deep under the ground...

Now i will plant a flagg on this place adn let my rover there - maybe with an update the cave becomes a movement upwards...
I think it's terrain detail you want on max. Some anomalies get buried underground with anything below max terrain settings.
I last checked it in .22. So no, changing the terrain setting wont do anything, as it's several hundred meters underground now...
I would love it if there was a cave system on Moho, next to a large crystal-like formation. Kudos if you get the reference

Scroll down on this:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/60551-Spoiler-Easter-Egg-Stocktake-0-23-%28Done%21%29-Pic-Heavy
Flying into a cave in a moon... Descent? Anyone?

I fart all day long.

omg why do u fart all day long!?
And on that classy note, it's time to let this thread go.
